strategy.trend_analysis: The hashtags incorporate a mix of highly specific primary tags related to the 'Function Dragon' concept, current trending challenges and communities like #MathTransformationChallenge and #ScienceTok, niche mathematical terms to attract dedicated learners, broad educational and STEM tags for maximum discovery, and engagement-driven calls to action. The strategy leans into visual and learning trends prevalent on Instagram Reels and Stories.
strategy.engagement_strategy: Engagement is driven by using direct calls to action like #WatchAndLearn and #ShareTheKnowledge, creating a sense of community with #LearnWithMe, and leveraging trending challenge formats (#MathTransformationChallenge) that encourage participation and sharing. The fun, character-driven nature of the content, amplified by hashtags like #MathIsMagic and #ComedyMath, also aims to foster positive engagement and virality.

usage_tips: On Instagram, aim to use a mix of 10-20 relevant hashtags. Place them in the caption or the first comment.
Prioritize the primary and trending hashtags for initial reach. Sprinkle in niche and broad hashtags for deeper discovery.
Monitor the performance of different hashtags to refine your strategy over time.
Consider creating branded hashtags for future episodes or related content to build your community.
For Reels, prioritize trending audio and visual effects in conjunction with these hashtags for maximum impact.

generation_metadata.topic: EPISODE 7: Function Dragon Transform!! Show this as HUGE ANIMATED TITLE CARD at the beginning for 3 seconds with epic effects! Create a Family Guy style comedy where baby dragon shape-shifter teaches functions. Explain transformation rules, domain and range, one-to-one and onto functions, bijections, function composition, even/odd functions, and periodic functions. Use visual metaphors: dragon transformation machine, territory maps, mirror and rotational symmetry. Make abstract function concepts concrete and entertaining.
